DOC.brief_summary: The nonpolypoid colorectal neoplasms (NP-CRNs) are relatively common in patients with gastrointestinal alarm systoms. The depressed lesions have a greater risk of having cancer than flat and polypoid lesions.
DOC.brief_title: Prevalence and Characteristics of Nonpolypoid Colorectal Neoplasms - A Chinese Cohort Study
DOC.criteria: consecutive adult patients undergo colonoscopy by one endoscopist
